title: What are the best websites to study philosophy for beginners? - Quora

response.answer_text: Wikipedia is the best. The Online Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy is more detailed, but way too verbose and influenced by individual guest writers as it is not open source. Wikipedia is a surprisingly sound source for philosophy. Start out by reading an article and making a list of every term or philosopher with which you’re unfamiliar (unable to speak on the matter for more than one-minute). Repeat the process for each of the pages on your list. Do this for months, and soon, you will no longer be a beginner. Be sure to begin reading the primary texts themselves at some point.

The Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy is a great resource for relatively accessible descriptions. The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy is more detailed, but also more technical and less accessible. There are a number of great websites for finding various philosophical texts for free: (I haven’t actually used all of these, so I can’t comment on quality) 441 searchable works of classical literatureSophia Project - Classical ArchivesEarly Modern TextsProject Gutenberg
